welcome.title: Welcome to
welcome.intro1: Step into an extraordinary world where nature, conservation, and luxury meet.
welcome.intro2: The Merlin Butterfly Sanctuary isn't just a beautiful attraction - it's a living laboratory dedicated to protecting Thailand's precious butterfly heritage.
welcome.askName: ‚ú® May we have your name, dear guest?

sanctuary.subtitle: Your exclusive butterfly experience awaits

about.title: About Merlin Butterfly Sanctuary
about.body1: More than just a beautiful garden, the Merlin Butterfly Sanctuary is a world-class conservation project. Our mission is to protect and restore declining local butterfly populations while creating a balanced ecosystem within the resort grounds.
about.body2: We're not just about enclosures - our philosophy centers on cultivating host plants for caterpillars and nectar-rich flowers that naturally attract and nurture butterflies, allowing them to fly freely throughout our gardens.
highlights: ‚Ä¢ 30+ native butterfly species bred and released
‚Ä¢ Complete life cycle observation from egg to adult
‚Ä¢ Breeding program featuring Golden Birdwing and other rare species
‚Ä¢ Natural habitat restoration using indigenous plants
‚Ä¢ Educational programs for guests and local communities

sanctuary.speciesIntro: From the majestic Golden Birdwing to the speedy Tailed Jay, discover the incredible diversity of butterflies thriving in our sanctuary. Here are some stars of our collection:

feedback.title: Thank You, {{name}}!
feedback.subtitle: We hope you enjoyed your magical experience! ü¶ã‚ú®
feedback.ask: How was your experience at the Merlin Butterfly Sanctuary?
feedback.prompt2: Please rate your visit to help us improve
feedback.thanksCardBody: Your opinion helps us create an even more magical experience. We look forward to welcoming you back soon! ü¶ã
feedback.commentPlaceholder: Tell us about your favorite moment, or ideas to improve...
feedback.optionalHint: Optional, but it helps us craft an even better sanctuary.
feedback.successMessage: Thank you! Your feedback has been saved.
feedback.errorMessage: Something went wrong. Please try again in a moment.
feedback.ratingRequired: Please tap a star rating before sending.

commonBirdwing.name: Common Birdwing
commonBirdwing.description: The star of our sanctuary! This magnificent golden beauty is the largest butterfly here, featuring spectacular golden-yellow hindwings contrasted against velvety black.
commonBirdwing.funFact: Protected species under CITES - one of the most sought-after butterflies by collectors worldwide.

images.alt: Common Birdwing gliding above orchids inside Merlin Sanctuary
images.caption: Gliding above orchids

images.alt: Close-up of Common Birdwing golden wings
images.caption: Wing details

commonTiger.name: Common Tiger
commonTiger.description: A graceful flyer with vibrant orange wings and bold black veining, reminiscent of the famous Monarch butterfly.
commonTiger.funFact: Successfully bred in large numbers at our sanctuary - you'll often see dozens dancing together.

images.alt: Common Tiger butterfly drifting through the tropical garden
images.caption: Graceful glide

images.alt: Common Tiger resting on bright lantana flowers
images.caption: Resting on lantana

commonMormon.name: Common Mormon
commonMormon.description: A master of disguise! This sleek black swallowtail features elegant white bands across its wings.
commonMormon.funFact: Females can imitate poisonous butterflies so perfectly that even birds are fooled.

images.alt: Common Mormon basking on a leaf at Merlin Butterfly Sanctuary
images.caption: Basking in the garden

images.alt: White-banded Common Mormon wing pattern close-up
images.caption: Mimicry details

tailedJay.name: Tailed Jay
tailedJay.description: A speed demon adorned with luminous lime-green spots scattered across black wings, rarely resting even while feeding.
tailedJay.funFact: One of the fastest flying butterflies - blink and you might miss it zipping past.

images.alt: Tailed Jay speeding past tropical foliage
images.caption: Speedy flight

images.alt: Tailed Jay sipping nectar from pink blossoms
images.caption: Nectar pause

leopardLacewing.name: Leopard Lacewing
leopardLacewing.description: Upper wings blaze with fiery orange and black stripes while the underwings reveal intricate lacework patterns.
leopardLacewing.funFact: The underside pattern resembles delicate lace fabric - nature's haute couture.

images.alt: Leopard Lacewing showing fiery upper wings
images.caption: Tiger stripes

images.alt: Underside lace patterns of the Leopard Lacewing
images.caption: Lace patterns

commonCrow.name: Common Crow
commonCrow.description: Elegant and regal, this deep glossy brown butterfly glides majestically with white-spotted wings.
commonCrow.funFact: Its slow, soaring flight pattern gives it an almost noble presence.

images.alt: Common Crow gliding through the sanctuary walkway
images.caption: Elegant glide

images.alt: Common Crow perched on a tropical branch
images.caption: Perched moment

commonEmigrant.name: Common Emigrant
commonEmigrant.description: A delicate wanderer dressed in soft whites and pale yellows, often fluttering around flowering bushes.
commonEmigrant.funFact: Named 'Emigrant' because they're known to migrate in large groups across regions.

images.alt: Common Emigrant glowing in afternoon sunlight
images.caption: Sunlit wings

images.alt: Common Emigrant spreading wings on a leaf
images.caption: Wings spread

chestnutBob.name: Chestnut Bob
chestnutBob.description: A tiny speedster skipper that zips around so quickly it seems to teleport from leaf to leaf.
chestnutBob.funFact: Skippers get their name from their unique bouncing, skip-like flight pattern.

images.alt: Chestnut Bob skipping between low leaves
images.caption: Leaf-skimming skip

images.alt: Chestnut Bob resting quietly on fresh foliage
images.caption: Quiet pause
